title: DeFi 101 Course
description:
"Decentralised Finance (DeFi) is the upcoming revolution in the world which would result in the complete transformation in the functioning of the finance sector using blockchain technology as its core." 
"This course, DeFi 101 , will introduce the learners to the world of blockchain and how it can be incorporated into the current financial system making it more efficient and secure than before. " 
"During the course, learners will be upskilled in the fields of Cryptography, Smart Contracts, Decentralised Protocols, Ethereum networks, Consensus Mechanisms (PoW & PoS), Flash loans, Digital signatures, Tokenization and many more! So, fasten your seat belts to know the future of finance."

topics.title: What is DeFi and Use Cases
topics.summary: This chapter explains basics of DeFi, How its different from Traditional Finance, and Use Cases
topics.description:
This chapter explains about
  * What is DeFi 
  * CeFi vs DeFi
  * Use cases of DeFi

questions.explanation: This is shown when the user answers the choice incorrectly

choices.content: It offers crypto based mining applications for effective utilization of resources.
It offers strategic DeFi investment products which allocate capital based on Machine Learning
It offers coding and machine learning solutions to develop Defi applications.
All of the about options

This video explains about
* Point 1
* Point 2

readings.title: Cryptographic Hash Functions
readings.details:
This video explains about
* Point 1
* Point 2

summaries.title: Consensus layer
summaries.summary: Blockchain is an public append-only data which allows persistence,consensus, liveness and is open
summaries.details:
- Persistence: once added, data can never be removed*
- Consensus: all honest participants have the same data**
- Liveness: honest participants can add new transactions
- Open(?): anyone can add data

summaries.title: Cryptographic Primitives
summaries.summary: Cryptographic Primitives.....
summaries.details:
- Collision resistant hashing: commit to data on a blockchain 
   ⟹ Merkle trees: commit to a list; later open one cell
- "Digital signatures: authorizing actions"
- "SNARK proofs: prove that a certain statement is true
   1. short proof
   2. fast verification"

summaries.title: Scaling the blockchain
summaries.summary: Ethereum L1 has a limit on number of transactions it can process
summaries.details: - Scaling the blockchain: Payment channels and Rollups (L2 scaling)

topics.title: Smart Contratcs
topics.summary: Explain on a high level what are smart contract, and where do they run
topics.description:
This chapter explains 
* How Ethereum transactions
* miner extractable value.
* Smart contracts / Gas / Oracles
* Fungible and non-fungible (NFT) tokens 
* dApps

topics.title: Tokenization
topics.description:
This chapter explains 
* Index Coop
* Set Protocol provides a way to combine portfolios much like an ETF holds many traditional stocks. The Sets can be active or passive. The module ends with a discussion of the use in DeFi of both wrapped bitcoin and wrapped ethereum.
* Wrapped bitcoin
* Balancer
